intro: Galium acutum var. himalayense, commonly known as Himalayan bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky slopes. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
